description: Revokes the current client access token (CAT) and returns new CAT for clients to use when reconnecting to secure tunneling to access the same tunnel. Requires permission to access the RotateTunnelAccessToken action.

parameters.name: tunnelId
parameters.description: The tunnel for which you want to rotate the access tokens.

parameters.name: clientMode
parameters.description: The mode of the client that will use the client token, which can be either the source or destination, or both source and destination.

parameters.name: destinationConfig
parameters.description: The destination configuration. thingName (string) --- The name of the IoT thing to which you want to connect. A list of service names that identify the target application. The IoT client running on the destination device reads this value and uses it to look up a port or an IP address and a port. The IoT client instantiates the local proxy, which uses this information to connect to the destination application. (string) ---

nested_params.name: thingName
nested_params.description: The name of the IoT thing to which you want to connect.

nested_params.name: services
nested_params.description: A list of service names that identify the target application. The IoT client running on the destination device reads this value and uses it to look up a port or an IP address and a port. The IoT client instantiates the local proxy, which uses this information to connect to the destination application.

nested_items.name: tunnelArn
nested_items.description: The Amazon Resource Name for the tunnel.

nested_items.name: sourceAccessToken
nested_items.description: The client access token that the source local proxy uses to connect to IoT Secure Tunneling.

nested_items.name: destinationAccessToken
nested_items.description: The client access token that the destination local proxy uses to connect to IoT Secure Tunneling.
